Ittay Dror wrote:

> 
> so let's take the case of the shopping cart. according to the above, 
> there shouldn't be any shopping cart resource. as a client, i just 
> browse a web site for items i want, then post them all, in one go, to 
> http://example.com/checkout. am i right?

No, there can be a shopping cart resource on the server that has state 
and that has a URI. That's not the only way to do it, but it's one way.

The key is that this shopping cart does have its own URI. The contents 
of the cart are not referenced by some sort of session token like a 
cookie that maps to the resource. The URI is the identifier, and 
different shopping carts have different URIs.

--
